data.title: Can't beat fun at the ol' ballpark
data.text:
Baseball is fun no matter what level is being played.  No, you are not going to see a Major League caliber game, but it is still fun seeing a play you have never seen before.  It is also a good way to introduce young children to the game without big expense of a big league ballpark - and parking is FREE on gamedays.

I prefer the reserved seating on the third base side so the sun is behind me during night games.  You can usually get seats close to the dugout and hear the chatter of the visiting team.

But as with any baseball park, keep aware of your surroundings because you never know when a foul ball is coming your way.

data.title: Very nice facility
data.text: Silver Cross field is a very nice venue.  It's well designed and well managed and it's a great place to watch a ballgame.  If you have problems walking up steps (as I do) there are elevators available to get you where you need to go.  The restrooms are clean and plentiful.  Very entertaining place to go.

data.title: baseball game
data.text: We had lots of fun and they had a firework show at the end. It was very clean. We went on a night when they had vendors giving free products and my niece had a blast.

data.title: Such a great place for families
data.text: The town of Joliet is so lucky to have this attraction! The stadium was beautiful, the staff were great, the activities during and after each game were so quaint, and the players were great. Tickets and ballpark food was incredibly affordable too!

data.title: Very nice facility
data.text: It's unfortunate that the Slammers are not more popular. I used to work for the team and Silver Cross Field is probably the best stadium in their league. The facility is still somewhat new and in great condition. There's seating along both baselines as well as grass seating. Nice scoreboard, great deals on food. It's independent baseball but kids will enjoy it. The only negative is the parking. The area around the stadium isn't the greatest and there's a lot adjacent to the stadium.

data.title: Awesome
data.text: The silver cross stadium is amazing it has lots of seating and grass seating which is nice. You can talk to the players on the bench and much more. They have one gift shop and many places to eat. Me and my friends always go to these games and have so much fun at them. The tickets are very cheap and are great!! They have many different nights that are themes. After the games in the summer they have either run the bases and or fireworks!

data.title: Fun family time
data.text: A fun inexpensive way to spend time watching a great sport with family and friends. Great facility! Parking is free and they have fun themed nights sometimes and fireworks

data.title: Grand Slam Fun
data.text: If you haven't been to a Slammers game, make time. Whether you live here or are traveling to the area, this is a day or night of family FUN! There is so much audience participation and something for everyone, young and old!

data.title: Take in a night of good baseball. Nice stadium!
data.text: If you are in town, take a day or night to watch a game in this little gem tucked in the downtown of Joliet. Parking is free and found all around the stadium. The tickets are reasonable and I don't think that there's a bad seat to be had. They have a huge scoreboard and decent ballpark food. The staff is helpful and friendly.

data.title: Great Baseball Venue
data.text: Watching baseball here is awesome! I've been several times over the last few years &  have never had a bad seat, including the lawn.  Reasonable priced tickets to make taking a family out for a fun afternoon/evening enjoyable without taking out a 2nd mortage.

data.title: Disney princess might
data.text: This minor league ball field is very comfortable, seats good, concessions reasonably priced. On field activities entertaining. Nothing fancy, just a comfortable ball park.

data.title: Great place to take kids young or older
data.text: This really is a nice park it never gets so busy that you have a hard time keeping up with your group. I still hate that the Jackhamners change their name to the Slammers. I do understand why they did it, but I May always refer to them as the jackhammers. They do have a lot of good food here.

data.title: Nice little ball park but the level of play is awful
data.text: What a great facility, as nice as some of the double A and triple A parks I have visited.  Too bad the ownership sets it sights so low with the product they put on the field.  Otherwise, a typical small town ball park atmosphere and food that you would expect.

data.title: Family friendly game.
data.text: We saw the Slammers and Cartoon Network was there.  So my younger kids had a great time.  Also there were a lot of mascots at the game.  It was very entertaining. Lots of things going on while the game was in progressed.

data.title: Joliet Slammers
data.text: Had a great night at the ball park! I'm a huge baseball fan though, so any night, at any ball park, would be a great night. JL Bird, their mascot, came and sat next to me. It's a great looking stadium. Very fun and enjoyable evening!

data.title: Great Value and Experience
data.text: This is an incredible ballpark.  Not a bad seat in the house.  It is cheap to get in and the ballpark food is very good and has an average price.  Plenty of on-field entertainment for the entire family.  We go to a lot of baseball games and this experience ranks right at the top for getting your money's worth and having a great time!

data.title: Tryouts in a week.
data.text: Come one come all.  (if your under the age of 27)  I being 62 can't tryout.  Sounds like a class action in the making.  The ability to compete at a high level is my trademark.  So hearing the age limit is pretty amazing.  You see after fighting in Nam.  I joined several teams and won several championships from 1974 through 1992.  No longer able to compete due to family obligations.  Putting food on the table.  For a family of 5.  Enabling them the chance to succeed.

data.title: Good for families.
data.text: We went the other day for a picnic/Slammers game for my boyfriends work. I was pretty bored and attendance was low. Although everyone's  children seemed to be having fun with the mascots and the between innings events. So I would suggest it more for a place to take your kids than go on a date. It was aTuesday and they had $2 draft beers so that's a pretty good deal. They also have a good selection of ballpark food and have fireworks after some games.

data.title: No bad seats
data.text: We've watched a few Slammers games here.  Good seats whether you want to sit in seats or on the lawn.  There's room for the kids to run around and not be trapped in a seat the whole time.  The food and drink aren't too expensive, but it's not too good either. We did the buffet on July 4th, and it wasn't worth the extra money and the line was long.   We've never had a problem finding free parking a short walk away. Always felt safe walking to/from the car.

data.title: SILVER CROSS FIELD
data.text:
Fun for families, Buy lawn seats they are the cheapest. No one stops you from sitting in the seats and there is always plenty open.
Because Milano Bakery is a major bakery in Joliet they toss rolls to the crowd.
